intro: Anastraphia maisiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves at the base. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Anastraphia maisiana thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
